original_title: Sri Lanka rupee closes at Rs306/307 to US dollar, bond yields steady
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka rupee ended at 306/307 to the US dollar on Monday, while bond yields were steady.
The Spot US dollar closed at 304.00/306.00 rupees on Friday after interventions around 314 to the US dollar and moral suasion, market participants said.
A bond maturing on 15.09.2027 closed at 23.00/23.10 percent, unchanged.
A bond maturing on 15.05.2026 closed at 24.80/25.20 percent, steady from the previous weeks close at 24.90/25.10 percent.
A bond maturing on 01.05.2025 closed at 27.00/10 percent, slightly down from 26.90/27.10 percent.
A six-month maturing bill closed at 19.00/20.25 percent down from 20.00/75 percent from Friday’s close.
A one-year bill closed at 16.75/17.30 percent, down from 17.25/18.00 percent.
